website_summaries.verdict: A right angle drill that is easy on the wrists and won't break your budget.
pros: Includes a durable Jacobs multi-craft chuck
Precision machine gearing delivers maximum power transfer and durability
cons: Sintered metal on the drill chuck's teeth are weak
Louder than comparable right angle drills

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition for when you need to drill in confined spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a drill for tight spots, in this case for extracting exhaust studs on a Ford Triton v-8. This combined with left handed cobalt drill bits did the trick when welding a nut on didn't, drilling out with conventional drills could not get the angle correct without removing engine etc... a nightmare job that this enabled us to complete. I would like a rethink on the trigger design that was easier to modulate and less likely to activate in tight spaces by the tight spaces...not sure how that would be accomplished, so no stars removed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McElhineyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for counterfeits
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if I got a knock off or what but I’m not impressed with this tool at all. The metal of the chuck teeth where the key turns is extremely poor quality. Multiple teeth have pretty much crumbled off. The chuck key is only about an inch and a half long and I have never tightened the chuck excessively. I have used ingersol rand air tools for 15 years and always been happy. This is probably counterfeit item which is disappointing as I went out of my way to purchase directly from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I use this mainly for hard to reach places (obviously) not so much disappointed with the tool itself the drill will twist your arm off if you're not careful, the chuck is my concern. It is a Jacob's chuck and needs a key to use (again pretty obvious) the fitment of the key to the chuck is kind of leaving more to be desired slips occasionally. Would buy again if it ever breaks but would probably swap chucks. I'm a diesel mechanic for a trash company so I put it through its paces and other than the chuck being a nuisance occasionally I love it
customer_reviews.author: Vytas Vaitkus

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Not Great.
customer_reviews.text: Used to drill out some exhaust manifold studs. Worked well. Ran in reverse with left handed drill bits and no problems. When trying to run in forward direction, it would stick and not rotate. Paddle needs to be smaller as this is for tight spaces, and the large size of the paddle is always hitting things and starting the drill.
customer_reviews.author: steven murphy

customer_reviews.title: KEPT IN DUST Proof CASE AND OILED Daily as recommended. i might have two hours most and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS NEW, KEPT IN DUST Proof CASE AND OILED Daily as recommended. i might have two hours most and it bound up and quit turning tried to find fix but no ones talking. ir is suppose to be great stuff , but not this drill its crap.
customer_reviews.author: GLEND46

customer_reviews.title: Very good drill for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a good drill for the money. My other identical one lasted 10 years of heavy use and constant oiling . I expect this one will last the same. It's foreign built though.
customer_reviews.author: Cobwebs and Candlesticks on YouTube

customer_reviews.title: Screams like no other.
customer_reviews.text: This thing can be heard for 3 miles in every direction. How they managed to make this so loud is in itself a miracle of engineering. WOW! The key to tighten the but is ridiculously small. Two important details.
customer_reviews.author: apb

customer_reviews.title: Powerful drill
customer_reviews.text: Great product but accidentally ordered two. Returned the extra item and was never given credit by Amazon (charged me for two drills even though the second was returned).
customer_reviews.author: Terrence D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: If your going for an angle drill then the 7807R is the way to go. The reversible can also be locked down so you dont have to hold it. Great drill!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: I have used this drill for a month or two and it works very well. Plenty of torque and reversible. My father has a blue point drill that is strikingly similar. The chuck holds tight, over all high quality product. Self employed auto and heavy equipment mechanic
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey H.

customer_reviews.title: saved me from taking out the radiator , fans and other parts good for tight areas
customer_reviews.text: Excellent saved me a lot of work from dismantling the engine
customer_reviews.author: Roberto M.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Nice build quality..do not like the touchy trigger...i wished it had the lock like other IR tools. But overall works well.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Minskey

customer_reviews.title: Must Have For Mechanics
customer_reviews.text: I'm an Ag Mechanic and purchased this drill to assist in removing a broken 3 point lift arm bolt. Without this right angle drill I would of had to remove the ROPS on the tractor to use a traditional drill. This drill will save you both time and headache. Cannot speak to it's durability, but it functions great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Bilodeau

customer_reviews.title: Awesome drill
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome drill and good price! Fast shipping was a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: this is a mint drill.. very easy on the wrists..great control..IR is usually on the pricey side but this right angle is very well worth the money...in the long run, it's better to spend a little more to buy a good quality tool..not harbor freight..which does have some decent stuff..
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Does  as  advertised
customer_reviews.text: It works well, and has good torque for a right angle drill I will be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: No key to tighten chuck
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I didn’t like about this item as it did not have a key to tighten the chuck on the drill. Thought it came with one
customer_reviews.author: mark v licatesi

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Works great. It could use a trigger safety lever to keep if going off everytime you set it down.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Right Angle Drill
customer_reviews.text: OK for the money. It works, but not very powerful. A LARGE compressor is required, as it requires lots of air volume. It is noisy, but it will get the job done. The instant reverse is nice as the lack of power causes the bit to get stuck often.
customer_reviews.author: David Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Works everytime.
customer_reviews.text: I am an aircraft mechanic and I use this drill everyday at work. This is a great product! It works everytime just as if it were new. I have seen cheaper drills last for a month then break. My tools are my livelyhood, so I buy a product that will make me more money.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Had to drill out exhaust manifold studs on ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Had to drill out exhaust manifold studs on a front wheel drive. Fit in the tight spot with out any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: Good and solid and well made. Works perfect on tight areas. It's a little loud for an air drill. Wear your ear protectors.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond McFall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good durable Ingersoll product - these are getting hard to find... well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Slammer

customer_reviews.title: Very Professional Tool
customer_reviews.text: Well made professional tool. This tool has plenty of power to drill 3/8 holes in metal.
customer_reviews.author: Roger D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little air drill, have used it for a few manifold jobs I would never have done with out.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: To get in thought spaces and reverse.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the ability to go in reverse. Used it to drill out manifold exhaust bolts.
customer_reviews.author: james e arnold

customer_reviews.title: Good air drill but being $60 more than the harbor ...
customer_reviews.text: Good air drill but being $60 more than the harbor freight one it does not justify the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Brad.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works Ok but I don't like having the paddle on the back
customer_reviews.author: DMG

customer_reviews.title: Good Product......
customer_reviews.text: I may only use this item once a year, but when you're in the situation to where you need it.....it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Butler

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Quality, Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is not a cheap China version, it is well made and smooth operating and worth the extra money over the cheaper versions
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Ear Plug needed
customer_reviews.text: Just got it,shipped real fast , seems to work well, its loud.
customer_reviews.author: Hello There

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Chuck key is a little sloppy but most ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Chuck key is a little sloppy but most other air drills I have used in the past were the same.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The variable speed is kinda touchy but still great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Cason

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: IR made another great product here. Compact and lightweight. What more would you need. Has plenty of torque and good speed control.
customer_reviews.author: kdl1150

customer_reviews.title: IR Drill
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it much but the quality is standard Ingersoll Rand. Not top of the line but not junk. Fits right in the middle and right in the middle of my budget. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: McKee Markings

customer_reviews.title: Instructions supplied with the tool could be better but it is not too difficult to figure out
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Instructions supplied with the tool could be better but it is not too difficult to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Ed D.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Good power and runs at a speed that I really liked. I have about 5 hours of rugged use on it and it's been flawless so far.
customer_reviews.author: pen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool- wish I d had it sooner, rather than the cordless I've been fighting
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good quality tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool for working in close quarters.Although I have not used it much yet,I think for the money,you can't beat it.I have one at work that is almost exactly the same thats been around for 20 years,gets used and abused by everybody in the shop, and it still works great.The reason I only gave it four stars is because,as has been pointed out,the ring gear on the chuck does look kind of cheap.Hope it does'nt break for me like it did that other guy.Other than that,I think its a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: craig

customer_reviews.title: fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: very good price have not had a chance to use it yet but happy wit purchase
customer_reviews.author: peter andrews

customer_reviews.title: Champion
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for tight places and has plenty of HP to bore through just about anything you want..
customer_reviews.author: BigDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Lots ot power on this little drill. It fit into a really tight space doing my Supercharger install on my car. Great Product, Great Quality!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Knipstein

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Money,...
customer_reviews.text: Owned several other angle drills, I tried someone else's IR 7807r. Immediately bought one for myself. If you have ever drilled out exhaust manifold bolts or need to, this is the right tool for the job. If you get one you won't be sorry, fast shipping and well packaged, plenty of power and speed control, reverse feature is very handy too.
customer_reviews.author: Vern Ainslie

customer_reviews.title: Top quality...
customer_reviews.text: Quality tool overall. I was surprised to see that the chuck was of old world (well machined) quality. I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: HLB

customer_reviews.title: Great for aircraft construction
customer_reviews.text: Using this to build a homebuilt aircraft. So far its dependable easy to use with accurate speed control
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Seems Great
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this a couple times, but am very happy. It is pretty loud from what I expected, but most air tools are loud. It has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: CreightonE

customer_reviews.title: It's got one speed, Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Overseas contractor. It's big, it's LOUD (coworkers were putting in their hearing protection around me when I use it), and the speed of the drill is very difficult to control. And don't think you can manuver this thing in tight spaces. I would not recommend this product to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: BryanP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great price,does the job, and have had no issues with it
customer_reviews.author: Tony Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 90 degree drill motor for a specific job in a very tight area. This drill motor fit the bill to do it. Drill motor is very well constructed and accomplished the job I needed it too.. Buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne S.

customer_reviews.title: Angle Drill
customer_reviews.text: Item was delivered as scheduled and in good condition. The drill is light weight and handy to use
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: tool working wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Good tool working wonderful yiu should get one for your self America it works thanks people Atlanta lee watts buy
customer_reviews.author: Letara watts

customer_reviews.title: nice drill at a great price
customer_reviews.text: definitely the drill for removing broken exhaust manifold bolts or any broken bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry H

product_meta.title: Ingersoll Rand 7807R 3/8: Standard Duty Air Angle Reversible Drill
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Ingersoll Rand 3/8" Chuck drills feature a quiet design, speed ranges from 1,200 to 2,500 and reversible and non reversible models. So, whether you are honing, reaming or drilling holes, we have a drill that is right for the application. One in a new family of economical, standard duty tools, the 7807R is an excellent choice for service work requiring a compact, low profile angle head. It's a durable, reliable tool for drilling in all types of materials, including sheet metal, wood and composites.
feature_bullets: Grease plug for easy preventative maintenance
Precision machine gearing ensures maximum power transfer and durability

specifications.Warranty Description: 1 year from date of purchase with sales receipt or invoice
